strappy-0.0

Safe HaskellNone

Strappy.Type

Contents

  • Types
  • Functions
  • Combinator Types

Description

This module defines a Hindley-Milner type system. It is based on Mark P. Jone's paper Typing Haskell in Haskell http://web.cecs.pdx.edu/~mpj/thih/.

Synopsis

  • data Kind
    • = Star
    • | Kfun Kind Kind
  • data Type
    • = TVar TyVar
    • | TCon TyCon
    • | TAp Type Type
  • data TyVar = TyVar Id Kind
  • data TyCon = TyCon Id Kind

type Subst

Arguments

 = [(TyVar, Type)]

list of type variable - type associations

Substitutions

Functions

(->-) :: Type -> Type -> Type

Function application. 

>>> tInt ->- tInt
(Int -> Int)

freshInst :: Monad m => Type -> StateT Int m Type

Return a type where each type variable is replaced with a new, unbound, type variable.

newTVar :: Monad m => Kind -> StateT Int m Type

mkTVar :: Int -> Type

Convenience function that returns a singleton type consisting of a type variable with specified integer id. 

>>> mkTVar 5
v5

mgu :: Type -> Type -> Maybe Subst

apply :: Types t => Subst -> t -> t

merge :: Subst -> Subst -> Maybe Subst

match :: Type -> Type -> Maybe Subst

eqModTyVars

Arguments

:: Type

t1

-> Type

t2

-> Bool 

Type equality modulo type variables. Returns true if the mgu susbtitution from t1 to t2 is just a renaming of type variables.

fromType :: Type -> Type

Get the source type of a function type (if it is not a function type then error).

toType :: Type -> Type

Get the target type of a function type (if it is not a function type then error).

tv :: Types t => t -> [TyVar]

isTAp :: Type -> Bool

Returns true if type is a function type.

isTVar :: Type -> Bool

Returns true if type is a singleton type variable.

enumId :: Int -> Id

readId :: String -> Int

nullSubst :: Subst

The empty substitution.

(-->)

Arguments

:: TyVar

u, a type variable

-> Type

t, a type

-> Subst 

Returns the substitution of u for t.
